# Automagically triage production alerts 
Use our AI agent to provide you timely context to slash MTTR, reduce alert fatigue, and prevent engineer burnout.
[**Schedule a Call**](https://vespper.com/<https:/cal.com/callwithtopaz/vespper>)
![demo of on-call ai agent by the name of vespper](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63e46460b3965816ad2ce316/63e46b8bdba8f8861ae86a65_Dasboard%20image02.png)
**Backed by**
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/66f1983511b27a1f5278eef3_ycombinator.avif)
**And built by folks from**
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/66f4db3449a9ddbca448a9d8_Google_2015_logo.svg.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/66f4db8e4dd500f9c04ca9a8_snyk.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/66f591249a8c4cbf4e321937_Viz.ai_Logo_Blue_Horizontal.jpg)
## Let's face it. Being on-call is a pain.
###### Needle in the haystack
Service uptime is harder to maintain as systems grow more complex. Teams are overwhelmed with data, making it tough to find the root cause quickly.
###### On-call burnout
On-call burnout leads to stress and high employee turnover. Automating incident response can turn 3 a.m. emergencies into manageable tasks.
###### Time is money
Downtime costs money and trust. Resolving incidents faster is essential to keep your 99.9% SLA intact.
## Meet Vespper - the first AI on-call engineer
###### How does it work?
  * Seamlessly integrate Vespper with your existing tools and workflows (DataDog, Grafana, Github, etc)
  * Vespper automatically troubleshoots alerts and incidents in real-time.
  * Focus on what matters while Vespper handles the rest.


###### What can vespper do?
  * Check anomalies in metrics
  * Dynamically query logs in your services
  * Automatically assess customer impact
  * Check whether a recent deployment caused an issue
  * Check if and how a previous alert/incident was solved


###### Who is this for?
  * Teams with outages
  * Teams that deal with strict SLAs and reliability is crucial
  * Teams growing quickly who want to make sure no alerts fall through the cracks 
  * Teams who have quick response to large incidents but still deal with a flood of low priority issues


## Connect Vespper to your favourite tools
Incident management tools, Observability tools, Collaboration platforms, Issue trackers, Knowledge bases and more!
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/671b1d61de4581c6e9a4f9b9_github-mark.png)![confluence integration](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/6677d31f064191f620131b9e_logo-jira.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/6677d5499a616f8ae8994d78_logo-confluence.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/671b1d38776b027536fa4464_dd_logo_v_rgb.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/6677d55eeac906e078860b63_logo-opsgenie.png)![slack integration](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/6677d55e15f57390fabe4c4f_logo-slack.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/6677d55e3795cc648f097d09_logo-pagerduty.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/6677d55ebc9e35b16337c1cc_logo-grafana.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/6677d55e5988b2e6221eba7d_logo-prometheus.png)
## Built for developers, by developers ❤️ 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bb51528afdbfc91736c116/67252b52dcc0d75a023df22b_topaz_dudu%20\(1\).webp)
Hi there! we’re Topaz and Dudu, former senior engineers at Google, Snyk, and Viz.ai. After countless sleepless nights spent firefighting alerts and incidents, we knew there had to be a better way. So we built this product to help developers like us tackle the pain of being on-call, making incident management less chaotic and more efficient.
[Talk to us!](https://vespper.com/<https:/cal.com/callwithtopaz/vespper>)
## Frequently Asked Questions
**How does Vespper ensure the security of my data?**
At Vespper, security is our utmost priority. We employ industry-leading security measures to safeguard your data and operations. This includes encryption protocols to protect data transmission and strict access controls to limit unauthorized access, providing you with peace of mind regarding the confidentiality and integrity of your information. If you have specific security concerns or requirements, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at security@vespper.com. Your trust and security are paramount to us, and we are committed to maintaining the highest standards of security for your peace of mind.To learn more about our security measures, please visit our [documentation](https://vespper.com/<https:/docs.vespper.com/Data%20Privacy%20&%20Security>).
**What sources does Vespper connect to for incident investigation?**
Vespper integrates with popular observability tools such as Datadog, Coralogix, Opsgenie and Pagerduty. It also integrations to popular tools, such as Slack, GitHub, Notion, Jira and Confluence, to gain insights on the problem. This extensive connectivity allows Vespper to fetch data from different sources, enabling it to connect the dots and conduct a thorough investigation for a comprehensive incident analysis.Additionally, we are continually expanding our integrations to include more platforms. If you have a specific integration request or suggestion, please feel free to contact us.
**Can I self-host Vespper?**
Yes, Vespper can be deployed to your own private cloud with your own private LLM provider
**What's your data retention policy?**
We retain data as long as it's needed and provide users with the option to delete it at any time. Our approach ensures full user control while maintaining strict security and compliance standards.
**How is a user defined?**
Users in Vespper generally map to on-call engineers, and they have the ability to talk to the bot and receive help.You can also create users for other stakeholders in your team, such as managers, tech support, etc. 
**Can I interact with Vespper directly in Slack?**
Absolutely! Vespper is designed for interactive collaboration. You can mention @vespper in your Slack channel to ask questions, seek assistance with ongoing investigations, or consult about potential solutions. It acts as a real-time AI assistant right at your fingertips.
**How easy is it to integrate Vespper into our existing workflows and systems?**
Integrating Vespper into your workflows and systems is incredibly straightforward. Our platform features a user-friendly dashboard with clear instructions on how to connect Vespper to the various resources within your company. The dashboard is designed to be self-explanatory, making the integration process smooth and hassle-free, even for users with minimal technical expertise.Moreover, you don't need to prepare your data upfront.For more information, you can visit our docs or send an email to [support@vespper.com](https://vespper.com/<http:/support@merlinn.co>)
**What's the meaning behind the name?**
Vesper, Latin for "evening" or "evening star," was chosen for its dual significance. It reflects on-call duties often performed in the evenings and symbolizes a guiding presence, like a star, supporting those on duty.fun fact, our logo designer also designed Docker's logo.

**Vespper: Your AI On-Call Engineer**

Founded in 2024, Vespper is making waves in the realm of software engineering by reimagining how teams manage production alerts. Operating out of Y Combinator's Batch F24, this tiny but ambitious startup comprises just two former senior engineers from Google, Snyk, and Viz.ai—Topaz and Dudu. They’ve experienced the stress of on-call duties firsthand and decided to create a solution that turns the chaos of tech support into a more manageable process.

### Mission and Product

At its core, Vespper is an AI agent that operates around the clock to troubleshoot production alerts, providing timely insights that reduce downtime and mitigate alert fatigue. This means less frustration for engineers who can focus on high-priority issues while Vespper automates the tedious aspects of incident response. Essentially, Vespper ensures that no alert falls through the cracks, significantly reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) and preventing engineer burnout.

### Features and Integrations

Vespper boasts impressive capabilities such as:
- Real-time troubleshooting of alerts
- Anomaly detection in metrics
- Log querying for insights
- Assessment of customer impact
- Tracking and resolution history of incidents

It also integrates smoothly with popular tools like DataDog, Grafana, GitHub, and Slack, making life easier for teams by streamlining their workflows.

### The Problem They Solve

Being on-call is often a stressful duty fraught with data overload and unexpected outages. Vespper addresses these pain points by automating many of the tasks that lead to burnout and downtime. Their service is particularly valuable for companies that rely on stringent SLAs and need quick, reliable incident management. 

### Why Vespper Stands Out

What sets Vespper apart is how it’s built—by developers for developers. The founding team knows the struggles of managing alerts under pressure and has indeed created a product that helps teams become more agile and responsive. Additionally, Vespper offers robust security measures, user control over data, and the potential for self-hosting.

### Connect and Learn More

If you're intrigued and want to see Vespper in action, you can book a demo on their [website](https://vespper.com). Moreover, they maintain a vibrant Slack community where you can engage with fellow users and the team. 

In summary, Vespper is not just another AI tool; it’s a thoughtful solution designed to alleviate the burdens faced by software engineers today, and they’re just getting started. Their commitment to reducing chaos in incident management makes them a promising player in the tech landscape.
